intro: Palmeria hypargyrea, commonly known as the silverleaf palmeria, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
